result.execSummary:
The defendant Clifford J Cline Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant, Clifford J Cline, in custody, appeared with Attorney Scott S. Schlough.  Prosecuting attorney Andrea Amidon Nodolf.  Defendant in custody.  Janell Evan - Clerk.  and 14CM273  9:05 AM

State argues sentence:  2 yrs prison and 2 yrs extended supervision.  Substance abuse program
Atty. Schlough argues probation for 30 month.  AODA
Defendant makes statement to the court.

COURT:  w/held sentence - ct. 1
36 months probation
cond: add'l 6 months jail w/Huber
AODA, No association w/anyone using controlled substances or be in the presence of paraphanalia, Any programming required by PO, Complete any mental health treatment suggested by PO 
$268 fine plus $250 DNA chg. DNA sample
credit for 126 days if revoked

Ct. 2 -w/held sentence -  2 yrs probation - concurrent
$243 find plus $200 DNA chg.


Ct. 3 - 30 days jail, credit for time served
$243 cc plus $200 DNA


14CM273 -  set for JT and FPT  Jury trial scheduled for December 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for November 30, 2015 at 11:00 am.

9:44 am - Jury enters.  Case called.  Panel sworn.  20 jurors seated in box.  9:52 - Voir dire by Court.  10:21 - Voir dire by State.   10:30 - Voir dire by O'Boyle. 10:53 - Jury panel selected and sworn.  Recess.  11:21 - On record outside of jury.  State offers redacted copy of bond form.. Defense does not object.  11:30 - Jury enters.  Court gives preliminary instructions.  11:34 - Opening statement by State.  11:37 - Opening statement by Atty O'Boyle.  11:45 - Jurors excused for lunch.  11:52 Court in recess.  Counsel to return by 1:00 pm.  1:02 pm - On record.  Jury not present. Parties continue to discuss miranda waiver.  Court finds defendant was asked if he understood his rights and there was an implicent waiver by defendant.  Ex. A - Bond form, rec'd by stip -will not go to jury,  Ex. B - Bond form rec'd by stip -  will not go to jury.  1:19 Jury enters. Ex. #1 - Bond form, rec'd by stip.  Ex. 2 - BOnd form, rec'd by stip.  State calls Inv. Dan Westlund.  Sworn & testifies. 1:33 pm - excused.  State calls Inv. S. McMahon.  Sworn & testifies.  1:50 - cross exam.  Ex. 3 (d) Drug task force report. Ex. #4 (d) Photo of closet.  Ex. #5 -(d)  Evidence report.  2:10 - redirect. 2:15 - re-cross.  2:17 excused.  State calls Dennis Mittelstadt.  Sworn & testifies.  2:26 - cross exam. Ex. #6 (d)- Photo .  Ex. #7 (d)- Photo of Desk and frito bag.  2:32 - excused.  10 minute recess. Court makes record regarding side bar at 1:48 pm.  2:52 - Jury enters.  State calls Office K. Knots.  Sworn & testifies.  Ex. #8 (p)- DVD w/photos, off'd & rec'd. 2:59 - cross exam. 3:04 pm - re-direct.  3:05 - re-cross.  3:05 - excused.  State calls Inv. M. Feeney. Sworn & testifies. 3:12 - Cross-exam.  Ex. #9 (p)- Supplemental report,  3:17 - excused.  State calls Deputy R. Day.  Sworn & testifies.  3:21 - no cross.  Excused.  State calls Katie Hoffmeyer.  Sworn & testifies.  Ex. #10 - Lab report, off'd.  3:29 pm - cross exam.  3:32 - cross exam. 3:33 - excused.  State recalls Inv. Westland.  Previously sworn.  Ex. 11 - Transmittal form, off'd & rec'd.  Ex. #12 - Inventory Record, off'd & rec'd.  Ex. #10 rec'd by Court.  Ex. #13  Notice from crime lab.  Off'd & rec'd 3:49 pm - cross-exam.  Excused.  Recess.  4:11 pm - Jury Enters.  State calls Deputy B. Sampson.  Sworn & testifies.  4:15 pm - cross exam.  4:16 - redirect.  4:16 - excused.  State has no further witnesses.  State rests.  Jury excused.  
(4:28)  back on record - Kim Silvius, Clerk
OBoyle - deft does not wish to testify - Court goes over his right to testify
OBoyle - defense has no further witnesses, argues motion re: possession - State argues possession
COURT:  finds there is sufficient evidence that jury could have a finding of possession of drug para. - MOTION DENIED

(5:27)  back on record out of presence of jury
(5:30)  jurors enter courtroom

OBoyle offers Exh 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 9 - State objects - Court receives for court only - Defense rests
(5:34)  Court reads instructions
(5:52)  Closing arguments by State (6:03)  Closing arguments by OBoyle  (6:17)  Rebuttal by State (6:21) objection by OBoyle - sidebar

(6:28)  Side bar requested by Mr. OBoyle
